etymologies: late Middle English: from Provençal cabestan, from cabestre ‘halter’, from Latin capistrum, from capere ‘seize’

definitions: a broad revolving cylinder with a vertical axis used for winding a rope or cable, powered by a motor or pushed around by levers.
shortDefinitions: broad revolving cylinder with vertical axis used for winding rope or cable

definitions: the motor-driven spindle on a tape recorder that makes the tape travel past the head at constant speed.
shortDefinitions: motor-driven spindle on tape recorder that makes tape travel past head at constant speed
